Proposed Storyline for 50 project

Episode 1: Introduction to the game.  You heard about a city awarding 
a contract to guard it.  You and your friends are going to compete to 
win that contract.

Episode 2:  You made it to the finals of the competition.

Episodes 3: You have to defend the city's trees from foresters who 
want to chop it down.

Episode 4:  You have to defend the city's storehouses from bandits.

Episode 5:  You have to defend the city's water supply.

Episode 6:  You have to defend the city's gates from destruction.

Episode 7:  You have to defend the city's crops from faeries.

Episodes 8: An invading army tries to besiege the city by keeping 
people from going and coming to the city.  You go out to meet the 
frontline defense.

Episode 9:  You are ambushed from 2 different sides by the invading 
army.

Episode 10:  The invading army is getting too close to the city for 
your comfort.

Episode 11: The invading army is too powerfull so you have to evacute 
the citizens from the city.

Episode 12:  You evacute the citizens into the forest.

Episode 13: You have to guard the citizens while they sleep in the 
forest.  Note: this will 3-4 civilians surrounded by a fort with 
doors.

Episodes 14: You find an entire city occupied by the undead and decide 
to clear out it to make room for the citizens.  First, you have to get 
through the outer defenses.

Episode 15:  You break into the city.

Episode 16:  You finally remove the undead from the city.

Episode 17: A group of bandit clerics (who just robbed a bank) return 
to the city to reclaim it.

Episode 18: You go after the remaining bandit clerics.

Episodes 19: You decide to return the treasure that the clerics stole. 
Unfortunately, thieves are waiting for you along the way.

Episode 20: All you have to town, unnoticed to return the gold.  
Unfortunately, that does not happen.

Episode 21: You return to the city, after receiving a reward, to find 
the city taken over.  You have to reconquer it. 

Episode 22:  You have to rescue the citizens held within the city..  
Note: this will have 2-4 prisoners in a protected cell with gates as 
doors; they won't appear until episode 24.

Episode 23: You increase the defenses of your city while guarding it.

Episodes 24:  Hearing, that the defenses have weakened, you fight 
tooth-and-nail to reclaim the city you lost in the beginning.

Episode 25:  You break through the city gates to face the few 
remaining soldiers inside.

Episode 26: You escort the citizens back to their city while guarding 
them from hazards of the forest. Note: not a save-the-npc level, only 
2-4 citizens show up.

Episode 27:  You are almost completely outside the forest, when you 
meet up with some bandits.  Only that is keeping you from reaching the 
city is the bandits.  Note: not a save-the-npc level, only 2-4 
citizens show up.

Episode 28: You built a completely underground tunnel connecting the 
two cities.  Unfortunately, while digging, you disturb the undead and 
orcs.

Episode 29: You station a small part of your forces in the 2nd city.  
The majority of your army runs off to secure a newly nearly abandoned 
city.  Upon, entering the city you discover lots of clerics and mages.

Episode 30:  After beating most of the clerics and the mages, you 
discover why the people fled: the clerics and mages were raising 
monsters.

Episode 31: You venture off to win a contract to protect a fourth 
city, one with a harbor.

Episode 32:  Your army surived the preliminary round, but must more 
difficult teams on a different terrain.

Episode 33:  Your army has to face one final battle to win the 
contract; unfortunately, your back is turned towards the sea. 

Episodes 34: On your way back to the city, you are ambushed by men.  
Unfortunately, these men are using the same tactics you use.

Episode 35: You had it coming by not screening new members of your 
army too well.  Someone from within your army has manage to gather 1/3 
of your forces against you.

Episode 36:  You have to defeat the last of the traitorous forces.

Episodes 37: While you are rebuilding your forces, another large 
number army approaches to conquer your cities.  You send your men out 
to take out the 1st wave.

Episode 38:  You hear that the army has fresh supplies at sea.  You 
move to board all those ships to keep the army from being resupplied.

Episode 39:  You mobilize in the field to keep the some enemy troops 
from crossing a river.

Episode 40:  You finally run into the bulk fo the opposing army; 
unfortunately, the terrain is miserable for fighting.

Episodes 41: You leave 3/4 of your army to engage in a small skirmish 
with the opposing army so that you can take 1/4 and sneak up on the 
camp.

Episode 42:  With 1/4 of your army, you enter the last remaing enemy 
camp throug the back and  you slaughter the remaining forces.

Episodes 43: You find a map to an abandoned mine and you take a small 
part of your army to explore it.  Upon, entering the mine, you find it 
occupied by barbarians.

Episode 44:  Upon going deeper into the mine, you find lots of gold, 
barbarians, and orcs.

Episode 45:  Getting near the bottom of the mine, you find undead and 
monsters that were sealed away.

Episode 46: A group of hired mercenaries try to steal the mine away 
from you.

Episode 47: Magic users have aligned to uproot you and your army.  
Taking out the first wave isn't too bad, considering most of them are 
unexperienced.

Episode 48:  Fighting the second is horrible, because you keep running 
into magical creatures.

Episode 49:  Your spies manage to find a major supply area for the 
magic users.  You decide to demolish the spies and the forces inside.

Episode 50:  You finally nail down the last of the magic users to one 
location.  Unfortunately, their creations are still around.

If this gets adopted, I propose we start working on getting the 1st 
five or so scenarios ready.
